steps: Set <synth-switch>Sync</synth-switch> to on
Make sure VCO 2 is set to a higher pitch/octave than VCO 1
Hold down <synth-button>Shift</synth-button>, turn <synth-knob>Int</synth-knob>.
Select a modulation effect with the <synth-switch>Select</synth-switch> switch
Hold down <synth-button>Shift</synth-button>, use <synth-switch>Select</synth-switch> to rotate sub-types.
Select the effect with the <synth-switch>Mod/Rev/Del</synth-switch> switch
Hold down <synth-button>Shift</synth-button>, and turn <synth-knob>Depth</synth-knob> to adjust wet/dry.
Enter Program Edit Mode, then tap <synth-button narrow>7</synth-button>

steps.step: Choose the target of the LFO's modulation

steps: Press <synth-button>Play</synth-button>
Press <synth-button>Motion Mode</synth-button>
Press <synth-button>Rec</synth-button>
Move knobs or switches. Up to four different things can be recorded
Smoothing can be configured in Sequence Edit Mode, button <synth-button narrow>12</synth-button>
Hold down one or more of the 1â€“16 buttons
Move a knobs or manipulate a switches. This will set the value for the steps you held down
Smoothing can be configured in Sequence Edit Mode, button <synth-button narrow>12</synth-button>
Enter Sequence Edit Mode, then tap <synth-button narrow>7</synth-button>
Step Resolution can be used to adjust how long each step is
Enter Program Edit Mode, then tap <synth-button narrow>7</synth-button>
Key sync resets the LFO on each note
Voice sync keeps all four voices of polyphony on the same cycle
Set the multi-engine switch to the bottom setting

steps.step: Adjust the <synth-knob>Type</synth-knob> knob to choose the type of noise:
details: Noise with a high-pass filter via <synth-knob>Shape</synth-knob>
Noise with a low-pass filter via <synth-knob>Shape</synth-knob>
Noise with a bandpass filter via <synth-knob>Shape</synth-knob>
Sample-rate reduced noise with <synth-knob>Shape</synth-knob> adjusting rate and <synth-button>Shift</synth-button> <synth-knob>Shape</synth-knob> adjusting keyboard tracking
